author: Some_Emo_Chick
text:
‘We’re Not Playing Chess’: Judge in
#Parkland School
#Shooting Case Lashes Out at
‘Unprofessional’ Defense Team for Suddenly Resting Case

#news
#florida

https://lawandcrime.com/live-trials/live-trials-current/nikolas-cruz/were-
not-playing-chess-judge-in-parkland-school-shooting-case-lashes-out-at-
unprofessional-defense-team-for-suddenly-resting-
case/

author: Jeramee
text:
[@Some_Emo_Chick]  
Sounds quite inappropriate from the judge, but we give judges huge amounts of
leeway. That leeway feeds judicial arrogance, and is yet another reason our
criminal justice system is so flawed.

author: Some_Emo_Chick
text:
[@Jeramee] I disagree completely. The fault
lies completely on the defense. They had 40 more witnesses lined up and
without warning just simply rested their case. I have never heard of anything
like that happening.

author: Jeramee
text:
[@Some_Emo_Chick]  
I would be inclined to agree if the judge hadn't cut her off. It likely would
have taken less than a minute for the judge to allow the defense to explain.
Maybe there was a reason to rest her case then, but we weren't allowed to hear
that because of the judge's decision. Until we hear the defense's reasoning,
it's patently unfair to side against them.

author: ne1for23
text:
Broward Circuit Judge Elizabeth Scherer sentenced the Parkland school shooter
to 34 consecutive mandatory life sentences in prison without the possibility
of parole. One for each of the 34 victims: 17 killed and 17 injured during the
2018 Valentine’s Day massacre at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

author: shannonstraw
text:
My son did his first lockdown drill at 3, the day after
#Parkland. As I was finishing my draft about
raising a child for whom preparing to avoid getting shot at school had become
routine, I got the breaking news alert about the shooting at
#MSU. https://www.insider.com/mom-shares-what-its-
raising-child-in-the-lockdown-generation-2023-2

author: Araignee
text:
[@shannonstraw]

My son was working in the Navy Yard the morning of the shooting. 12 dead

My daughter lived one block from the Columbia Mall shooter. 3 dead

I was having lunch with co-workers just outside where the Capital Gazette
shooting was taking place. 5 dead

Then there was the DC Sniper attacks. We had to use our bodies as human
shields to get our students on and off the bus every day after they shot one
of our students. 17 dead

And that's just me.

author: shannonstraw
text:
[@Araignee] Ooof. I'm so so sorry that that's
your reality. May you all have respite from the lingering trauma and find
healing.

over #Parkland shooting response  
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-
canada-66061166

The fact that these charges were raised in the first place is another example
of a country in social and political decline. Scapegoating a lowly paid and
ill-equipped school resource officer and expecting him to have self-sacrificed
instead of tackling the root causes. And all merely to continue ignoring the
truth and keeping an utterly mindless gun culture alive.

Hold my beer, this is not where it ends.

text:
On this solemn day, families will come  
To the site of the Parkland school massacre and succumb  
To the sorrow that lingers here still  
The memories of loved ones who never will  
This site will be visited by their family's dear

author: LGmedia
text:
A #Florida senator wants to eliminate a
statewide 3-day wait to buy a rifle or a shotgun, undoing one of the changes
enacted after the #Parkland massacre.
Jonathan Martin’s bill would keep the waiting period in place for handguns
while ending it for other firearms. The
#Republican proposal (SB 1124) has
alarmed #gun control advocates who fear it
will make it easier for unstable people to quickly access weapons, including
the AR-15 rifle used in some of the nation’s deadliest mass shootings.

author: MiamiCaricaturistJeffSterling
text:
Tuesday morning I stopped by the
#CoralSpringsFlorida
#McDonald's slightly south of
#Parkland to enjoy the steak egg and
cheese bagel meal. When I went to the pickup window the server gave me the
food and I asked politely for ketchup. To my amazement, he sheepishly replied
"Oh I'm sorry sir. We ran out of ketchup." Seriously. How disorganized can
management be? #IdiotsonParade  
I never run out of toilet paper, paper towels or food because I ALWAYS plan
ahead.
